member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.BayesPointMachineClassifierInternal.CompoundBinaryFactorizedInferenceAlgorithms.ComputeLogEvidenceCorrection
member.summary: Computes the logarithm of the model evidence corrections required in batched training.
member.returns: The logarithm of the model evidence corrections.
member.remarks: When the training data is split into several batches, it is necessary to eliminate evidence contributions which would otherwise be double counted. In essence, evidence corrections remove the superfluous contributions of factors which are shared across data batches, such as priors and constraints. To compute the evidence contributions of the factors shared across batches, one can compute the evidence on an empty batch.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.BayesPointMachineClassifierInternal.CompoundBinaryFactorizedInferenceAlgorithms.ComputeLogEvidenceContributionEmptyBatch
member.summary: Computes the logarithm of the model evidence contribution of an empty batch.
member.returns: The logarithm of the computed model evidence contribution of an empty batch.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.BayesPointMachineClassifierInternal.InferenceAlgorithms`3.ComputeLogEvidenceCorrection
member.summary: Computes the logarithm of the model evidence corrections required in batched training.
member.returns: The logarithm of the model evidence corrections.
member.remarks: When the training data is split into several batches, it is necessary to eliminate evidence contributions which would otherwise be double counted. In essence, evidence corrections remove the superfluous contributions of factors which are shared across data batches, such as priors and constraints. To compute the evidence contributions of the factors shared across batches, one can compute the evidence on an empty batch.

member.summary: Computes the logarithm of the model evidence contribution of an empty batch.
member.returns: The logarithm of the model computed evidence contribution of an empty batch.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.BayesPointMachineClassifierInternal.CompoundDenseBinaryBpmTrainingEvidence_EP.Execute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing the given number of times
member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. If this is less than the number already done, message-passing is restarted from the beginning. Changing the observed values resets the iteration count to 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.BayesPointMachineClassifierInternal.CompoundDenseBinaryBpmTraining_EP.Execute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing the given number of times
member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. If this is less than the number already done, message-passing is restarted from the beginning. Changing the observed values resets the iteration count to 0.

member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing the given number of times
member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.BayesPointMachineClassifierInternal.GaussianDenseMulticlassBpmTrainingEvidence_EP.Execute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Update all marginals, by iterating message-passing the given number of times
member.param: The total number of iterations that should be executed for the current set of observed values. If this is more than the number already done, only the extra iterations are done. If this is less than the number already done, message-passing is restarted from the beginning. Changing the observed values resets the iteration count to 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.Mappings.IBayesPointMachineClassifierMapping`4
member.summary:
A mapping to access data in the native format of implementations of the
interface.
member.typeparam: The type of the instance source.
The type of an instance.
The type of the label source.
The type of a label.
member.remarks: This interface allows to provide features in one of two representations: dense and sparse. To provide features in a dense representation, all arrays over feature indexes must be null and all instances must have the same number of feature values. To provide features in a sparse representation, each single instance must have the same number of feature indexes and values (arrays over feature indexes must not be null).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.Mappings.IBayesPointMachineClassifierMapping`4.IsSparse(`0)
member.summary: Indicates whether the feature representation provided by the instance source is sparse or dense.
member.param: The instance source.
member.returns: True, if the feature representation is sparse and false if it is dense.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.BayesPointMachineClassifierPredictionSettings`1.SetPredictionLossFunction(Microsoft.ML.Probabilistic.Learners.LossFunction,System.Func{`0,`0,System.Double})
member.summary: Sets the loss function which determines how a prediction in the form of a distribution is converted into a point prediction.
member.param: The loss function.

An optional custom loss function. This can only be set when is set to 'Custom'. The custom loss function returns the loss incurred when choosing an estimate instead of the true value, where the first argument is the true value and the second argument is the estimate of the true value.

member.param: The custom loss function. This is null unless the returned is 'Custom'.

member.remarks: A loss function returns the loss incurred when choosing an estimate instead of the true value, where the first argument is the true value and the second argument is the estimate of the true value.
